value.content: The following compatibility tables try to summarize the state of CSS support for HTML forms. Due to the complexity of CSS and HTML forms, these tables can't be considered a perfect reference. However, they will give you good insight into what can and can't be done, which will help you learn how to do things.

value.title: Values
value.content:
For each property, there are four possible values:

✅ Yes

There's reasonably consistent support for the property across browsers. You may still face strange side effects in certain edge cases.

⚠️ Partial

While the property works, you may frequently face strange side effects or inconsistencies. You should probably avoid these properties unless you master those side effects first.

❌ No

The property doesn't work or is so inconsistent that it's not reliable.

n.a.

The property has no meaning for this type of widget.

value.title: Rendering
value.content:
For each property there are two possible renderings:

N (Normal)

Indicates that the property is applied as it is

T (Tweaked)

Indicates that the property is applied with the extra rule below:

css

* {
  /* Turn off the native look and feel */
  appearance: none;
}

value.title: Compatibility tables
value.content: Altering the appearance of form controls with CSS, such as with border, background, border-radius, and height can partially or fully turn off the native look & feel of widgets on some browsers. Be careful when you use them.

value.title: Text fields
value.content: See the text, search, and password input types.

value.title: Buttons
value.content: See the button, submit, and reset input types and the <button> element.

value.title: Number
value.content: See the number input type. There is no standard way to change the style of spinners used to change the value of the field, with the spinners on Safari being outside the field.

value.title: Check boxes and radio buttons
value.content: See the checkbox and radio input types.

value.title: Select boxes (single line)
value.content:
See the <select>, <optgroup> and <option> elements.

Note Firefox does not provide any way to change the down arrow on the <select> element.

value.title: Select boxes (multiline)
value.content: See the <select>, <optgroup> and <option> elements and the size attribute.

value.title: Datalist
value.content: See the <datalist> and <input> elements and the list attribute.

value.title: File picker
value.content: See the file input type.

value.title: Date pickers
value.content: See the date and time input types. Many properties are supported, but there is too much inconsistency between browsers to be reliable.

value.title: Color pickers
value.content: See the color input type:

value.title: Meters and progress
value.content: See the <meter> and <progress> elements:

value.title: Range
value.content: See the range input type. There is no standard way to change the style of the range grip and Opera has no way to tweak the default rendering of the range widget.

value.title: Image buttons
value.content: See the image input type:
